title: Real Estate Operations Manager (Full-Time | U.S. Portfolio | Long-Term Role)
description:
About Us



We are a stable, U.S.-based real estate business managing a growing portfolio of rental properties, mid-term rentals, and client properties.



We are building a dependable long-term operations team so the business runs smoothly, professionally, and consistently.



If you have real experience in U.S. property management and want to grow with a company that values structure, respect, and consistency, we would love to meet you.



This is a long-term role ‚Äî not a short-term project.



Schedule



Monday‚ÄìFriday | 9:00 AM ‚Äì 6:00 PM EST

Lunch: 1:00 PM ‚Äì 2:00 PM EST (unpaid)

40 hours per week



When an Airbnb guest check-in occurs on a Saturday, limited monitoring may be required (typically 1‚Äì2 hours total). Any Saturday time will be offset during the week.



Weekend maintenance is handled through a structured voi
 system with clear emergency rules. This is not full-day weekend coverage.



Position Overview

We are hiring a Real Estate Operations Manager to help manage daily property operations, tenant communication, vendor coordination, and executive administrative support.



You will also help manage and organize our Gmail inbox using a structured authority system (what you can handle independently vs. what requires approval).



This is not an entry-level VA position. We are looking for someone experienced, organized, and confident handling U.S. tenants and vendors.



Responsibilities



Rental Operations (Owned + Client Properties)

Communicate professionally with tenants by phone and

Monitor rent status and follow up according to process

Coordinate maintenance vendors and track work orders

Ensure repairs are completed and documented

Support lease renewals and vacancy coordination

Schedule showings and assist with applicant screening

Maintain organized digital property records

Forward invoices and documentation to the bookkeeper (no bookkeeping entry required)



Brokerage Administrative Support

MLS data entry and listing coordination

Draft listing descriptions

Schedule inspections and photography

Track contract deadlines

Maintain transaction checklists and organized folders



Airbnb / Mid-Term Rental Support (Low Volume)

Guest messaging and check-in coordination

Cleaner scheduling

Posting guest reviews

Tracking supplies

(Average approximately 2 check-ins per month)



Executive Admin + Gmail Management

Daily inbox triage and organization

Labeling and archiving
s

Drafting and sending operational communications

Preparing a short daily Executive Brief (Urgent / Needs Decision / Completed)

Tracking follow-ups and reminders

Maintaining organized Google Drive folders



 Authority Structure

You may respond directly for operational coordination (scheduling, confirmations, vendor follow-ups).

More sensitive items (lease renewals, payment notices, owner updates) will be drafted for approval.

Legal matters, negotiations, and financial commitments remain with ownership.



Required Qualifications



Minimum 2+ years experience in U.S. property management

Strong spoken and written English

Comfortable making professional phone calls

Vendor coordination experience

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Strong Google Workspace skills (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets)

Experience using property management software

Reliable internet and professional workstation



Preferred:

MLS or transaction coordination experience

Airbnb or mid-term rental experience



Compensation

PHP 32,000 ‚Äì 38,000 per month (based on experience and performance)

Paid twice monthly via Wise



This is a long-term role with opportunity to grow as our portfolio expands.



Application Instructions (Read Carefully)



To be considered:

Submit your resume.

Record a 2‚Äì3 minute video answering:

Why are you qualified for this role?

Describe a difficult tenant situation you handled.

What would you do if a vendor does not respond?

Provide a screenshot of your internet speed test.

Provide a photo of your workstation.

In the subject line of your application, include the reference code: REOM-27



Applications without the reference code will not be reviewed.

PIMS is a fast-growing UK property maintenance company providing reliable, high-quality services across the property industry. We work with landlords, property managers, and businesses nationwide, and we pride ourselves on glowing customer reviews, strong referrals, and repeat business.

ing clients (newsletters, referral offers, upsells)

title: Bookkeeper Virtual Assistant
description:
Position Overview



We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Bookkeeper Virtual Assistant to support our accounting and financial operations. The ideal candidate must have strong experience in QuickBooks. Familiarity with ServiceTitan is highly preferred but not required, with the ability to manage invoices, perform reconciliations, and assist with month-end financial reviews.

This role requires excellent organizational skills, can work independently, accuracy, and the ability to work independently while coordinating with internal team members.



???? Key Responsibilities

1. Invoice and Bill Processing

Save and organize all incoming invoices and bills in the proper filing system

Enter invoices and bills into QuickBooks Online accurately

Post transactions to the correct vendor, account, and payment method

Review invoices for errors or duplicates before posting





2. Expense and Transaction Monitoring

Review and categorize bank transactions synced in QuickBooks

Ensure expenses are coded to the correct accounts

Identify missing, duplicate, or incorrectly posted transactions

Perform weekly transaction cleanup and accuracy checks





3. Undeposited Funds Management

Verify payment amounts, applied payments, and balances

Batch and post deposits to the appropriate accounts

Ensure payment records match QuickBooks data



4. Credit Card Management and Reconciliation

Coordinate with team members to obtain monthly credit card statements

Reconcile multiple credit card accounts in QuickBooks

Compare statement transactions against QuickBooks entries

Identify and resolve:

Missing transactions

Duplicate entries

Incorrect expense categorizations

Post any missing transactions

Maintain reconciliation reports using Excel when needed



5. Bank Reconciliation

Reconcile multiple checking accounts monthly

Verify deposits, withdrawals, transfers, and refunds

Ensure balances match bank statements and QuickBooks records

Investigate discrepancies and make corrections



6. Month-End Close Support

Reconcile ServiceTitan revenue with QuickBooks revenue reports

Investigate revenue discrepancies or unusual fluctuations

Assist with adjusting journal entries when required



7. Profit and Loss and Expense Analysis

Run monthly Profit & Loss reports (accrual basis)

Analyze expenses and compare against:

Previous months

Prior year data

Review detailed transactions for:

Correct vendor and account coding

Proper posting dates

Supporting documentation



8. Financial Data Quality Control

Identify and correct:

Duplicate expenses

Personal or non-business expenses

Misclassified transactions

Improper credit card postings

Review and validate large or unusual transactions

Assist with expense adjustments and reclassifications



9. Documentation and Reporting

Maintain supporting documents such as invoices, receipts, and expense records

Document financial variances and unusual transactions

Prepare notes and reports for management review

Flag items requiring approval or follow-up



10. Team Coordination

Communicate regularly with accounting team members

Participate in review meetings and financial presentations

Provide administrative and bookkeeping support as needed



? Required Qualifications

Proven experience as a Bookkeeper

Strong experience with QuickBooks

Experience or familiarity with ServiceTitan (Highly Preferred but not required)

Experience in HVAC industry is a plus

Strong understanding of reconciliation processes

Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills

Proficiency in Excel or Google Sheets

Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

Strong written and verbal English communication skills



? Preferred Skills

Experience supporting U.S. based businesses

Experience with month-end close processes

Knowledge of accrual accounting

Experience working as a Virtual Assistant or remote bookkeeper



? Work Schedule

Aligned with U.S. business hours ‚Äì EST Timezone (to be discussed)



???? Work Setup Requirements

Reliable internet connection

Backup power and internet

Quiet and professional work environment

title: Social Media & Content Strategy Manager
description:
Focus: Organic growth, thought leadership, and high-quality execution



About the Role

We are looking for a Social Media Manager who can translate complex ideas about neuroscience, trauma, and behavior change into clear, compelling, and emotionally intelligent content. This role supports a personal brand rooted in credibility, depth, and long-term trust, not trends or gimmicks.



This is not an influencer or meme account.

This is a thought leadership brand in neuroscience, performance, and emotional intelligence.



You will be responsible for helping shape and execute a content strategy that grows an audience organically and positions the founder as a trusted voice in the field.



Core Responsibilities

- Content Strategy & Planning

- Build and manage a weekly content plan aligned with brand pillars

- Translate high-level ideas into clear post concepts

- Identify repeatable content formats and series

- Support long-term visibility and audience trust, not short-term virality



Content Creation & Editing

- Draft captions and short-form scripts

- Shape educational and emotionally resonant posts

- Repurpose content across platforms (Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)

- Ensure tone is grounded, warm, intelligent, and human



Brand Voice & Positioning

- Maintain consistency with founder‚Äôs voice and values

- Protect emotional safety and credibility in messaging

- Avoid hype, fear-based marketing, or shallow trends

- Help position the brand as authoritative and trustworthy



Performance & Optimization

- Track saves, shares, comments, and profile growth

- Identify what resonates and refine strategy

- Recommend what to repeat, what to drop, and what to evolve

- Focus on learning systems, not vanity metrics



Audience Growth (Organic)

- Identify aligned collaboration opportunities

- Support podcast clips, reposts, and distribution strategies

- Help content travel through trusted networks

- Assist with outreach to aligned creators or platforms



Who You Are

You likely have:

- 2‚Äì3 years experience managing social media for a brand or thought leader

- Strong writing and synthesis skills

- Comfort with educational or science-based content

- Ability to turn complex ideas into clear, relatable language

- Emotional intelligence and respect for sensitive topics

- A calm, organized working style

- High integrity and transparency in your work



You are not:

- Trend-obsessed

- Focused on gimmicks or shock tactics

- Dependent on templates without thinking

- Overly promotional or salesy



Must-Have Skills

- Excellent written English

- Strong conceptual thinking

- Content planning and structure

- Basic analytics understanding

- Ability to take feedback and iterate

- Organized and self-directed

- Comfortable working with a founder-led brand



Bonus Skills

- Background in psychology, neuroscience, or wellness

- Experience with personal brands or experts

- Light video editing or Canva skills

- Experience repurposing long-form into short-form



Important Notes:

This role is for someone who wants to grow into strategic content leadership, not just schedule posts. You will be working with sensitive material about trauma, beliefs, and behavior change. Emotional maturity and good judgment are required.



Send your application with the subject: Social Media Manager Application - [Full Name]

title: Youtube Video Editor
description:
Job Description:

We are looking for a talented and detail-oriented video editor to help create high-quality, engaging videos. The ideal candidate should have experience working with raw footage from phone recordings and be able to enhance content through expert editing, seamless transitions, and creative additions.



What You'll Do:

1. Tailored Workflow & Enhanced Quality: Optimize raw footage with noise reduction, audio leveling, and effects to elevate overall content quality.

2. Precise Editing & Efficiency: Edit and enhance videos while ensuring quick turnaround times without compromising quality.

3. Professional Video Editing: Deliver precise and creative edits to match the project‚Äôs needs.

4. Post-Production: Provide comprehensive post-production services to ensure polished, professional results.

5. Color Correction: Apply color grading and correction to enhance the visual appeal of videos.

6. Sound Design: Add background music, improve audio quality, and create an immersive audio experience.

7. Creative Storytelling: Make decisions on where to insert B-rolls, animations, zoom transitions, and graphics to make videos more engaging.

8. Subtitles & Captions: Add subtitles for accessibility and engagement.

9. Organizing Clips & Footage: Structure videos from beginning to end with a seamless flow.

10. Transitions & Video Effects: Implement smooth transitions and effects for a professional touch.

11. Intro & Outro: Create engaging intros and outros to enhance brand identity.

12. Multiple Revisions: Open to feedback and revisions to achieve the desired final product.



Ideal Candidate:



- Experienced in editing phone-recorded content

- Creative and detail-oriented

- Understands sound design and background music selection

- Proficient in color grading and correction

- Skilled in using professional video editing software (Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, Final Cut Pro, etc.)

- Efficient and deadline-driven



If you're passionate about video editing and can transform raw footage into engaging, high-quality content, we'd love to hear from you!



To apply, please send:

1. Examples of past video editing work

2. Are you willing to sign an NDA before getting the materials to edit?

3. Your typical turnaround time for a 3-5 minute video

4. Are you willing to create a short sample? We will provide raw footage for the test.

title: Amazon FBA Shipments & Operations VA (Night Shift PHP)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



We are a US-based Amazon FBA wholesale business operating a live warehouse and palletized FBA shipments. We are hiring a full-time Amazon FBA Shipments & Operations Specialist to support daily warehouse operations, Amazon shipment creation, inspections, and Seller Central case management.



This is a high-responsibility, operations-critical role. You will work closely with US warehouse staff and management in real time. The business is growing quickly, workflows evolve, and priorities can change daily. This role is ideal for someone who is flexible, proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable operating in a fast-paced environment.



This is not a passive or SOP-only role. While core workflows exist, you are expected to ask questions, communicate frequently, and help solve problems as they arise.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Amazon FBA Shipment Creation (Outbound to Amazon ‚Äì Core Responsibility)

- Create and manage Amazon FBA shipments for mixed-SKU boxes and pallets

- Enter and verify quantities, ASINs, SKUs, FNSKUs, UPCs, and expiration dates

- Support palletized / LTL shipments to Amazon (experience is a plus)

- Coordinate closely with warehouse staff during outbound shipment creation

- Adjust shipments when Amazon splits, flags issues, or changes destinations



Incoming Inventory Inspection & IRR (Inbound to Warehouse ‚Äì Core Responsibility)

- Review warehouse photos and videos of incoming pallets and inventory

- Verify inbound product details:

- UPCs, ASINS, Expiration dates, Quantities

- Complete Incoming Inspection / IRR forms accurately

- Maintain clean, accurate inbound inspection records in Google Sheets

- Identify and flag discrepancies before inventory is staged for FBA shipment



Amazon Seller Central Case & Account Health Management (Core Responsibility)

- Handle Amazon Seller Central case management

- Track shipments post-send and monitor receiving issues

- Open and follow cases for:

-- Missing inventory

-- Damaged inventory

--Unfulfillable inventory

--Reimbursements

- Upload invoices and supporting documents

- Monitor account health and policy notifications



Coordination & Communication

- Coordinate daily with US warehouse staff

- Join multiple short calls throughout the US workday as needed

- Communicate clearly and proactively when issues arise

- Work with other Philippines-based tea
mbers during overlapping hours

- Ask questions instead of waiting when something is unclear



REQUIREMENTS

- Amazon Seller Central experience required

- Strong understanding of Amazon FBA workflows, ASINs, and shipments

- Comfortable with heavy data entry and verification work

- Strong Google Sheets / Excel skills

- Extremely detail-oriented

- Able to work in a fast-paced, changing environment

- Strong written and verbal communication skills

- Comfortable working US night hours

- Comfortable with frequent short calls and real-time coordination



IMPORTANT NOTES (PLEASE READ CAREFULLY)

- This role operates in a live warehouse environment

- Workflows evolve as the business grows

- You must be comfortable with ambiguity and change

- You are expected to communicate, ask questions, and adapt

- This role requires ownership, not just task execution



TO APPLY ‚Äì ANSWER ALL QUESTIONS BELOW

1. Do you have experience creating Amazon FBA shipments with mixed SKUs? Any pallet or LTL shipment experience?

2. Describe your experience working inside Amazon Seller Central (shipments, cases, account health, reimbursements).

3. Are you comfortable reviewing warehouse photos/videos, verifying UPCs and expiration dates, and completing IRR / inspection forms?

4. Can you work Monday‚ÄìFriday, 9am‚Äì5pm US Central Time (night shift PH) and handle frequent short calls throughout the day?

5. This role involves changing priorities and incomplete SOPs at times. How do you handle ambiguity and problem-solving in fast-paced operations?



Applications that do not answer all questions will not be considered.

title: GoHighLevel Automation Specialist 25,000 - 50,000 PHP/month  (Long-Term) ‚Äì Workflows, Payments, WhatsApp, Hiring Systems
description: We are hiring a high-skill GoHighLevel (GHL) Automation Specialist for long-term work. This is not a one-time workflow project. You will build and maintain our full GHL automation system across multiple locations/sub-accounts (Canada + USA). Core responsibilities include: building billing and payment automations (pipeline stage triggers, automated invoice sending, WhatsApp/SMS/email follow-ups, stop conditions once paid, and manual verification logic for e-transfer and Zelle), building client follow-up automations (no-response sequences, polite reminders, escalation rules, tasks/manual call prompts), building internal operations automations (worker completion tracking, internal notifications, handoffs, and status updates tied to the correct client/opportunity), and building hiring + onboarding automations (application flows, screening logic, automated follow-ups, interview scheduling support, onboarding sequences). You must be extremely skilled in GHL workflows (triggers, if/else routing, waits, custom fields, tags, pipeline logic, and preventing duplicate sends). You must be fast and output-driven, able to ship clean systems quickly, document what you build, and maintain/improve the system monthly. Strong communication and the ability to troubleshoot workflow issues is required. To apply, include a short Loom showing one automation you built inside GHL and briefly explain the logic.

title: Experienced Remote Medical Scribe (Pain Management) | 1+ yr Scribing + 1+ yr Healthcare BPO | eClinicalWorks Preferred
description:
REMOTE MEDICAL SCRIBE (PAIN MANAGEMENT) - EXPERIENCED

Full-time | US Central Hours | eClinicalWorks (eCW)



ABOUT THE ROLE

We are a US-based pain management clinic looking for an experienced remote Medical Scribe who can chart in real time and produce clear, medically accurate notes with excellent English.



WHAT YOU WILL DO (SCRIBE WORK)

- Real-time charting for provider visits: HPI, ROS, Physical Exam, Assessment & Plan

- Keep documentation clear, concise, medically accurate, and grammatically clean

- Use templates/macros appropriately (speed + consistency, not copy/paste errors)

- Pre-chart when needed: pull prior notes, organize key clinical history, reconcile key details

- Support documentation for pain management / PM&R / ortho-spine style visits



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

Please DO NOT apply unless you meet ALL requirements below:

- 1+ year Medical Scribing experience (remote or onsite)

  - Must include actual provider documentation (HPI/PE/A&P), not only scheduling/PA/referrals

- 1+ year Healthcare BPO experience (US-facing accounts strongly preferred)

- Strong spoken and written English (must understand fast patient/provider conversations)

- Typing speed: 50+ WPM with high accuracy (include your WPM in your message)

- Comfortable learning and following provider-specific documentation style

- Reliable workstation + stable internet + backup power source



PREFERRED (STRONG PLUS)

- eClinicalWorks (eCW) experience

- Experience scribing in Pain Management / Ortho-Spine / PM&R

- Healthcare background/education preferred: RN, PT, Pharmacist, Medical Technologist, etc.



PAY

$5.00 to $8.00 per hour depending on verified scribing experience, BPO background, and eCW exposure.



IMPORTANT: HOW TO APPLY (READ CAREFULLY)

To confirm you read this post, start your message with:

SCRIBE-ECW



In your FIRST message, include:

1) Your scribing background (specialty + years)

2) Your healthcare BPO background (account type + years)

3) EMR/EHR systems used (include eClinicalWorks if applicable)

4) Typing speed (WPM) and confirm you can work US Central hours

5) Confirm you have a backup power source



Applications that do not follow the instructions above will not be reviewed.

title: Amazon Compliance Specialist
description:
Regulatory & Legal Compliance



Conduct in-depth research on FDA, EPA, FTC, and other relevant federal and state regulations.

Ensure compliance with international product safety standards (EU, UK, Canada, Asia-Pacific) when applicable.

Perform ongoing monitoring of regulatory updates and interpret implications for product categories.

Support intellectual property due diligence to prevent patent, copyright, or trademark infringement.



Risk Management & Product Compliance



Evaluate new and existing products for compliance risks and advise stakeholders on mitigation strategies.

Develop compliance testing protocols and coordinate with third-party labs and certification agencies.

Manage corrective actions, recalls, or withdrawals in alignment with Amazon‚Äôs policies and legal requirements.

Conduct audits of product listings and seller submissions to prevent unlawful or restricted product selection.



Cross-Functional Collaboration



Partner with Legal, Product Development, Supply Chain, and Seller Performance teams to execute compliance initiatives.

Provide clear guidance to vendors, suppliers, and internal teams on compliance requirements.

Train cross-functional stakeholders on compliance best practices and emerging regulatory risks.

Act as a subject matter expert to business teams during product launches, regulatory reviews, and inspections.



Policy & Process Development



Draft and implement compliance procedures, standard operating protocols (SOPs), and escalation processes.

Support automation and system-based compliance controls to scale monitoring and enforcement.

Contribute to internal policy development regarding restricted products, product claims, and safety certifications.

Continuously improve workflows to enhance accuracy, timeliness, and audit readiness.



Documentation & Reporting



Maintain accurate records of compliance assessments, approvals, and regulatory correspondence.

Prepare detailed reports and risk assessments for leadership review.

Provide supervisors with regular feedback on task progress, emerging risks, and resolution status.

Ensure confidentiality of sensitive data, supplier information, and Amazon business strategy.





Experience interacting directly with regulators including federal and state agencies

Experience in research and analyzing federal and state regulations

Familiarity and experience in dealing with FDA regulation is REQUIRED

Familiarity with international compliance frameworks (REACH, RoHS, CE marking).

Experience in compliance auditing, regulatory affairs, or legal review.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills for engaging with global teams and regulators.

Ability to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with strict deadline

title: Senior Video Editor
description:
Senior Video Editor (Philippines ‚Äì Full Time)



Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment Type: Full-Time Contract (40 hours per week)

Timezone: Must operate in alignment with AEST / AEDT

Contract Term: 12 months - on-going full-time work offered based on the quality of work

Compensation: ?40,000 ‚Äì ?70,000 per month (based on experience and capability)





About REKT Productions:

REKT Productions is an Australian-based production company delivering premium corporate content, advertisement, interviews, livestreams, branded films, and broadcast-level media across Australia and international markets. We work on a multitude of industries including esports, gaming, tech, government, medical and more.



We operate with structured workflows, defined review systems, and professional project management. We are building a long-term post-production team capable of delivering consistent, high-quality corporate and commercial work.



Role Overview:

We are seeking a Senior Video Editor with strong experience in corporate, commercial, and documentary-style editing.



This role is focused on execution excellence. You will be responsible for transforming briefs, footage, and structured creative direction into polished, client-ready corporate films.



**This is not a social-media-first or gaming-focused role**. You will be expected to still deliver social-media focused content, but the primary output will serve corporate clients, commercial campaigns, and service-based industries.



Core Responsibilities:

- Edit corporate interviews with natural, seamless B-roll storytelling

- Deliver polished commercial advertisements for products

- Execute service-based corporate brand films and informative content

- Perform audio cleanup and balancing (professional standard required)

- Focus on sound design with effects, music and themes

- Apply colour correction and grading using LUTs and manual fine-tuning

- Integrate basic motion graphics when required (no complex animation work)

- Deliver projects in alignment with structured review systems and deadlines

- Maintain professional file organisation and workflow discipline



**You will not be responsible for uploading content, talking directly to clients, or designing complex graphics. Your focus is editing execution and quality control.**



Required Experience:

- 5‚Äì10+ years professional editing experience

- Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro and/or DaVinci Resolve

- Strong understanding of colour grading fundamentals

- Firm knowledge & execution of sound design, including audio mastering & sound implementation

- Experience delivering corporate and commercial content

- Fluent written and spoken English

- Professional remote editing setup capable of reliable exports and fast turnaround

- Agency, corporate production house, or strong freelance backgrounds are all acceptable.



This role requires:

- Clear communication with project managers

- Structured weekly reporting

- Ability to work under time-sensitive conditions when required

- Consistent delivery quality across varying workloads

- Ownership and care in execution

- Ability to work in a team & manage deadlines



**Weekend work is rare and only expected during genuine time-sensitive situations.**



Compensation Structure:

A reasonable amount of over-time hours are expected.



?60,000‚Äì70,000

Expert Senior-level editor capable of consistent, high-volume output. This role would be expected to lead all video projects, and have a strong level of input. As the team scales, this role would shift toward management and oversight of the editing arm of REKT.



?50,000‚Äì60,000

Strong Senior editor delivering consistent quality with minimal supervision. They are expected to have strong experience in corporate editing and are able to execute high levels of quality with minimal reviews.



?40,000‚Äì50,000

Senior-level editor who follows direction accurately and produces reliable outputs.



**Compensation will be determined based on demonstrated ability.**



Ideal Candidate Profile:

- Structured and organised

- Calm under pressure

- Direct communicator

- Detail-oriented

- Competitive in standards

- Committed to long-term growth



**Poor communication or inconsistent output will not be tolerated. Professionalism and reliability are essential.**



Application Requirements

Submit the following:

- CV (PDF)

- Portfolio showcasing corporate and commercial work

- Monthly salary expectation within the stated band

- Confirmation of availability for AEST/AEDT alignment

- Description of your editing process for turning interview footage into a polished corporate story

- Shortlisted candidates will be required to complete a paid test edit.

title: Operations Coordinator ‚Äî US Installation Company (Night Shift)
description:
IG National is a US-based national installation company specializing in security cameras, access control, and low-voltage infrastructure. We manage installations across all 50 states through a network of field technicians and subcontractors.



We are looking for a detail-oriented Operations Coordinator to join our team and help manage the daily workflow of our installation operations. This is a full-time, long-term position with a growing company.



WHAT YOU WILL DO



- Accept and process installation orders on our vendor platform

- Order equipment, cable, and supplies for each job

- Update our tracking systems (Airtable/Smartsheet) with job details and status

- Assign field technicians to jobs through our dispatch platform (Work Market)

-
 customers with installation dates and status updates

- Route and plan installations ‚Äî determine which technician covers which job based on location and availability

- Coordinate equipment shipping and track deliveries

- Confirm technicians have accepted their assignments and are on schedule

- Send technicians scope documents and site-specific instructions before each job

- Track and reconcile Amazon purchases against job records

- Manage equipment returns and RMA requests

title: Construction Estimato
description:
About Us



Smith & Son Construction is a growing U.S.-based construction company specializing in residential and commercial construction, including custom home builds, remodels, additions, ADUs, tenant improvements, foundations, and commercial renovations. We are expanding and seeking an experienced Estimator who understands U.S. construction standards, pricing structures, and project workflows.



We are looking for someone who wants long-term stability and growth with a company, not short-term freelance work.





Position Overview



We are hiring a full-time Construction Estimator with a minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of estimating experience working with U.S.-based clients.



The ideal candidate is highly analytical, detail-oriented, and experienced in reviewing plans, performing takeoffs, and preparing accurate estimates aligned with U.S. construction practices.



This is a long-term, full-time role.



Work Schedule (Required)



Monday‚ÄìFriday



8:00 a.m. ‚Äì 5:00 p.m. Pacific Time (PST/PDT)



Availability during these exact hours is mandatory



Please apply only if you can consistently work within Pacific Time business hours.





Key Responsibilities



Review architectural and structural drawings, specifications, and scope documents



Perform detailed quantity takeoffs



Prepare comprehensive cost estimates for residential and commercial projects



Solicit and evaluate subcontractor and supplier pricing



Develop trade breakdowns and scope sheets



Identify scope gaps, cost risks, and inconsistencies



Assist with proposal preparation and budgeting

Required Qualifications

Experience with quantity takeoffs



Proficiency in Excel and estimating software (please specify which programs you have used)



Strong attention to detail and accuracy



Excellent written and verbal English communication skills





Preferred Qualifications



Experience with residential remodels, custom homes, additions, or commercial tenant improvements



Familiarity with CSI trade divisions

Knowledge of U.S. building codes and permitting processes

description:

Must be extremely organized, punctual, reliable and able to follow directions. If you think you qualify for this position reply with only GOOGLE DOCS in the subject line, nothing else.

title: Xero CPA / Bookkeeper (Setup, Cleanup, Reconciliation)
description:
We are looking for an experienced CPA or Senior Bookkeeper to fully set up and optimize our Xero accounting system for a growing digital services and SaaS business. This role is focused on building a clean, reliable financial foundation and maintaining accurate books going forward.



You will be responsible for configuring Xero correctly from the start, cleaning historical data, and ensuring our accounts are categorized and reconciled properly.



Responsibilities

Xero Setup & Configuration

- Set up Xero chart of accounts tailored to a SaaS / services business

- Configure tax settings, currencies, and financial reports

- Connect bank accounts, credit cards, and payment processors

- Ensure proper user permissions and account structure

Data Cleanup & Migration

- Review existing transactions and historical data

- Clean up miscategorized or duplicate entries

- Import and organize past financial records if needed

- Standardize naming conventions and account usage

Categorization & Reconciliation

- Categorize transactions accurately and consistently

- Perform monthly bank and card reconciliations

- Identify and resolve discrepancies

- Ensure financial reports match actual balances

Ongoing Bookkeeping

- Maintain accurate books on a weekly or monthly basis

- Prepare Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow reports

- Support year-end and tax preparation

- Communicate clearly about any issues or missing information



Requirements

- Proven experience with Xero accounting software

- CPA license or strong bookkeeping background preferred

- Experience with SaaS, digital services, or online businesses

- Strong understanding of financial reporting and reconciliation

- High attention to detail and organization

- Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in English

- Experience connecting tools such as Wio, Mercury, Fanbasis, Whop, or similar is a plus



Nice to Have

- Experience with multi-currency accounts

- Familiarity with crypto or digital asset tracking

- Knowledge of US or Canadian accounting standards

- Experience cleaning messy or partially set up books



Engagement Details

- Part-time or project-based to start, with potential for ongoing monthly work

- Remote

- Flexible hours, results oriented

mbers to bring ideas to life.

‚Ä¢ Add Special Touches: Use sound, music, transitions, and graphics to make videos pop.

‚Ä¢ Stay Updated: Keep up with the latest video trends and tools to always deliver top-quality work.

‚Ä¢ Listen and Improve: Take feedback from others to make each video even better.



What You Need to Bring:

‚Ä¢ Experience using video editing tools like Adobe Premiere, After Effects, or DaVinci Resolve.

‚Ä¢ Experience with Log Color Profiles and 32 bit float

‚Ä¢ A sharp eye for detail‚Äîyou‚Äôll spot what others might miss.

‚Ä¢ Creative problem-solving skills.

‚Ä¢ Great time management to meet deadlines.

‚Ä¢ The ability to work well with others and bring out the best ideas.

‚Ä¢ Reels for Social Media



Why Join Us?

At Live Consequential, we help entrepreneurs grow their businesses by connecting, learning, and working together. As a Video Editor, you‚Äôll play a key role in making this mission come to life through impactful videos.



How to Apply:

Watch this video:



After that, send us your resume, WE ONLY REVIEW APPLICANTS THAT WATCHED THE VIDEO a short note about why you‚Äôd be a great fit, and examples of videos you‚Äôve edited.



Let‚Äôs create something extraordinary together.

title: ADVANCED TECHNICAL VA - Systems & Automation Specialist
description:
WHO WE NEED



A technical powerhouse who builds and maintains business automation systems‚Äînot someone who just follows instructions.



You should be the person other VAs come to when something breaks.



---



REQUIRED TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE



Must Have:

- GoHighLevel - Custom workflows, automations, webhooks, pipeline architecture

- Zapier - Multi-step workflows, filters, formatters, API connections

- ClickUp - Workspace design, custom fields, automations, dashboards

- LMS Platforms - LearnWorlds, Teachable, or similar (course setup, integrations)

- AI Tools - Advanced prompt engineering (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini)

- Documentation - Screen recording (Loom, Tango), process mapping



---



RESPONSIBILITIES



- Design and build GHL automations and pipelines

- Create complex Zapier workflows connecting multiple platforms

- Architect ClickUp workspaces with custom automations

- Troubleshoot automation failures and fix broken integrations

- Create SOPs with screen recordings for non-technical users

- Integrate AI tools into business workflows



---



AUTO-REJECT CRITERIA



- No portfolio examples of GHL workflows you've built

- Never built multi-step Zapier workflows with filters/formatters

- Never designed a ClickUp workspace from scratch

- Computer has less than 16GB RAM

- Internet slower than 200 Mbps or no backup connection

- No backup power source

- Cannot work night shift (US timezone)

- Does not include the word "Champion" in application



---



COMPENSATION



Rate: $7-8/hour USD (based on technical assessment)

Schedule: Night shift (8pm-5am or 9pm-6am PHT), 40 hours/week, Monday-Friday

Start: Immediate



---



PORTFOLIO REQUIRED



Submit Google Drive folder with:

1. GHL workflow screenshots/videos

2. Zapier integration examples (multi-step)

3. ClickUp workspace screenshots (custom fields, automations)

4. LMS work samples

5. One "before/after" process improvement example



No portfolio = automatic rejection



---



ABOUT US



Sales training company for home service contractors. You'll build automation systems using GoHighLevel, ClickUp, LearnWorlds, Zapier, and AI tools to support our CEO, operations team, and coaching programs.



High-impact technical role for someone who wants to build systems that scale a business.



---



APPLY NOW



We review applications daily and interview qualified candidates immediately.



No portfolio? Don't apply.

Applications without the word "Champion"? Auto-rejected.

title: Digital Marketing
description:
Role Overview



The Digital Marketing & Communications Coordinator will manage and elevate the company‚Äôs online presence across website, social media, newsletters, and LinkedIn. The role focuses on brand storytelling, team culture, and inspirational travel content, with a strong emphasis on client attraction and engagement. Paid advertising is limited, with priority given to organic growth and strategic content management.









Key Responsibilities



Website Management



Lead revamp and ongoing maintenance of the company website on Squarespace

Collaborate on design, content, and structure to enhance user experience, SEO, and lead generation

Monitor website analytics and optimize performance







Social Media Management



Execute a light social media revamp and manage content creation, posting, and engagement

Initially, content will be reviewed and approved; the role will evolve to independent management

Develop posts that are educational, inspirational, and engaging, avoiding sales-heavy messaging

Showcase office culture, team activities, and relatable travel experiences

Maintain a consistent posting schedule: 3 posts per week (video or graphics preferred)







Google Ads & SEO



Manage Google Ads campaigns to drive qualified website inquiries

Track campaign performance and adjust strategies to improve lead quality and conversion rates







Newsletter Management



Create and distribute monthly or fortnightly newsletters to nurture existing clients

Include updates from the team, promotions, expos, and relevant industry information

Ensure content is concise, engaging, and consistent with brand voice







LinkedIn Strategy



Develop and execute proactive LinkedIn campaigns to attract new clients

Share thought leadership, company updates, and industry-relevant content

Build relationships with potential clients and partners through strategic engagement

Focus on LinkedIn as the primary platform for growth, with minimal attention to
/Instagram ads







Key Skills & Qualifications



Experience in social media management, content creation, and LinkedIn strategy

Familiarity with Squarespace, Google Ads, and basic SEO practices

Strong writing, visual storytelling, and communication skills

Ability to create video and graphic-based content

Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple platforms and campaigns independently

Success Measures



Consistent, high-quality content across all digital channels

Increased engagement, website inquiries, and qualified leads

Growth of LinkedIn presence and proactive client acquisition

Timely and engaging newsletter delivery

title: Accountant With WAVE Bookkeeping Skills
description:
Hello,

  

My name is David. I am a partner in Embark Empire, a conglomerate of companies in the USA with operations in Houston, SW Florida, Wyoming, Puerto Rico, Atlanta, California, Arkansas, Atlanta, and North Carolina.  I am seeking a bookkeeper to work with our tax planning division,. Criterion Advisors Group Corp.  Bonus points for team management skills.  You will start out assisting as a staff bookkeeper for our clients or for an in-house Embark Empire company. For the right candidate, this will lead to promotions or even a management position. Your assignments could be varied, fast paced at times, and challenging.



Bitrix 24 is our Project Manager and CRM cloud based platform where we all come together online. Time is tracked with Hubstaff. Our staff lives all over the US and the Philippines.  You will find that Bitrix 24 provides the key technological framework to stay organized and in communication which is key to a duplicatable business format system. I like to say that Embark Empire is a virtual company since most staff works from home.  We  We are quite ideal for VAs.



If your are interested, I have some questions. Do you have a cell phone where we can call you on WhatsApp when necessary? Is your broadband connection fast?  What type of laptop or computer do you have? 

Do you know the WAVE bookkeeping software?



If our interview together goes well, Henz who runs our PH VA team will conduct a second phone interview. We have 12 VAs ;who work for CRETA which is the staffing company division of Main Street.  I founded Main Street Holdings which is a business and governmental affairs consulting firm for business owners. You would be assigned to work with clients or work with one of the core Embark Empire firms by Criterion Group Advisors which is Main Street's sister company for tax planning of which I am a partner.  



Let me know your questions and thoughts. We are hiring and I would like to arrange an Initial interview with you ASAP.



Kindest regards,



David A. Svec

Managing Member

Main Street Holdings LLC



Mobile:

title: EXPERIENCED SHORT FORM VIDEO EDITOR | Flexi Schedule
description:
We‚Äôre hiring someone who knows how to turn long-form content into sharp, high-retention short videos for platforms like TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



This role is for someone who understands pacing, hooks, and visual rhythm in short-form content, and knows how to edit with intention rather than just cutting clips.



‚Äî-----------------------------------------------------------------------------



READ THE ENTIRE JOB LISTING CAREFULLY. The final step of the hiring process will require the candidate to provide at least 1 former employer/team lead reference and at least 1 character reference. These will be verified prior to extending an offer.



--- ABOUT THE TEAM ---

Want to work in a rewarding, fast-paced, start-up atmosphere? Looking for significant growth and performance bonus opportunities? Have a growth mindset, value relationships, and dedicated to getting results? Then we might be a fit!



What is it like to work with us? HEAR FROM OUR TEAM!   





Our Core Values:

1) DELIGHT THE CLIENT:  We consistently exceed expectations by anticipating needs, delivering outstanding service, and creating those ‚Äúmagic 
nts‚Äù where every client feels seen and heard.

2) MASTER YOUR CRAFT:  We commit to continuous learning, share our expertise openly, and tackle every challenge with precision and a deep sense of duty.

3) FOLLOW THROUGH, ALWAYS:  When we say something will happen, it does‚Äîevery time. We own every task, ensuring that nothing falls through the cracks, and when mistakes occur, we learn and improve immediately.



Our core values are important and the right candidate will share our values. We are building an awesome place to work, not just cutting together videos for our real estate business.



--- ABOUT YOU ---

Do you have strong creative instincts and know how to spot 
nts that make people stop scrolling? Are you proactive, adaptable, and detail-oriented? Do you have a sharp sense of pacing, an instinct for hooks, and a clear understanding of how short-form videos need to flow to hold attention? Do you take pride in clean edits and delivering videos that feel intentional and finished? Do our core values sound like a fit for who you are?



Then keep reading to see if we're a fit!



Responsibilities:

Short-Form Editing & Story Selection

- Review long-form videos, transcripts, or raw footage to identify short-form clip opportunities

- Select 
nts that are clear, engaging, and platform-appropriate

- Edit vertical videos optimized for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts

- Create strong hooks, clean cuts, and natural pacing

- Deliver publish-ready videos that meet brand and platform standards



Captions, Visuals & Formatting

- Add on-screen captions (burned-in or SRT as required) with proper timing and readability

- Apply basic motion, zooms, punch-ins, and visual emphasis where appropriate

- Follow platform-specific formatting (aspect ratio, duration, safe margins)



Iteration & Workflow

- Implement feedback efficiently and meet agreed turnaround times

- Maintain clear file naming and folder organization

- Track edits, revisions, and delivery status as required



Requirements:

- A STABLE, HIGH-SPEED INTERNET CONNECTION, REQUIRED (at least 150mbps)

- Experience with Final Cut Pro X (or other editing software, such as Adobe After Effects and Premiere Pro) is required

- Strong preference for MacOS users

- Experience editing short-form vertical content for social platforms, required

- Strong understanding of short-form pacing, hooks, and retention

- Experience working from transcripts or long-form content, required

- Clean file organization and understanding of post-production workflow

- Portfolio of completed short-form video projects, required

- General understanding of brand, content marketing, YouTube, etc, required

- GREAT interpersonal and communication skills, required

- Ability to self-start, work on a tight schedule, and manage multiple project deadlines, required

- Ability to follow directions and a LOVE of completing lots of projects according to consistent specifications, required

- Growth mindset, required



--- APPLICATION & RECRUITMENT PROCESS ---

STEP 1:

Fill out the application form through the link below and write "green kangaroo" in the Additional Comments field.


 



STEP 2:

Qualified candidates may be invited to participate in two PAID test projects, $10-20 USD for each test project estimated to be 2-3hrs of work for each (a total of $40 USD!).



STEP 3:

Candidates who advance through the test project rounds will be invited to an interview.



STEP 4:

Before extending a trial offer, we will conduct a CHARACTER REFERENCE CHECK for the final candidate(s). CONDUCTING A REFERENCE CHECK will be the last step in the hiring process.



STEP 5:

Upon receiving a trial offer, you will be onboarded as a Video Editor with a 90-day PAID trial period. During this period, we expect you to demonstrate your video editing expertise, meet project deadlines, be a team player, and excel at what you do. A successful trial will lead to a permanent offer to join the team.

title: Para-Broker / Mortgage Broking Credit Analyst
description:
Para Broker - Credit Analyst ‚Äì Australian Mortgage Broking (Medical & Complex Lending Specialist)

Work from Home | Full-Time | 60,000 - 75,000 PHP pm



Are you an EXPERIENCED / SENIOR Para-broker or Credit Analyst ready to level up your career and be part of a thriving, high-performing team? We're an established mortgage brokerage based in Australia, specialising in Finance for Medical professionals ‚Äî but we handle residential (owner-occupied and investment), commercial, SMSF, complex, and high-net-worth lending.



We're not your average brokerage. Every day is different. Every file presents a new challenge. Our clients are driven, intelligent professionals ‚Äî and they expect the same from us.



That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre looking for a **GENUINLY EXPERIENCED** Credit Analyst / Para - Broker ‚Äî not someone who ONLY submits applications via AOL or plays a broker support/admin role.



What We‚Äôre Looking For:



End-to-end experience: From researching borrowing structures, assessing servicing, recommending lenders, and preparing strong applications ‚Äî through to following deals to settlement.



Confident across multiple loan types: You‚Äôve worked on residential, investment, commercial, SMSF, and trusts, and you're comfortable navigating credit policy across major banks and non-bank lenders.



EXCELLENT English communication skills: You‚Äôll liaise directly with brokers and sometimes clients ‚Äî explaining your recommendations clearly and concisely.



Problem-solving mindset: You enjoy working through complex deals and helping find smart, viable solutions.



Not a support role: If your background is primarily in administration or document collection/submission only, this role is NOT suitable.



A successful applicant will have experience working with AOL, Mercury & Quickly. If you do not know what these programs are, then you are NOT qualified to enquire for this role. 



Why Join Us?



* Work with a tight-knit team of 3 brokers and 3 support staff who LOVE what they do

* We have a 100% approval track record and highly satisfied clients ‚Äî your work will directly impact real outcomes

* Above-market salary for the right candidate ‚Äî we pay well and value skill

* A fun, fast-paced culture ‚Äî every day is different, and we keep things exciting

* Full-time, permanent, work-from-home role: Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm AEST





How to Apply



Please DO NOT send a CV only.



We want to hear from you.

Send us a short VIDEO INTRODUCTION  (2‚Äì4 minutes) where you:



* Walk us through your experience as a Credit Analyst

* Explain the types of loans and clients you‚Äôve worked with

* Tell us how your role differs from broker support or admin staff

title: E Commerce Growth Lead, Build Our Digital Revenue Engine, Amazon First, Launch New Channels
description:
E-Commerce Growth Lead



Build and Own Our Digital Revenue Engine



About Us



We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility or design patents. We manufacture in Canada where possible and source electronics overseas when required, then protect and position products properly.



We have dominated brick and mortar retail for decades. Our online channels are underdeveloped relative to product strength. We want fast, measurable improvement without the owner operating day to day.



The Role



This is a full-time ownership role, not support.



You will treat our ecommerce operation as if it were your own business. That means thinking in terms of revenue, margin, risk, prioritization, and long-term value, not tasks.



You will start by owning Amazon Seller Central execution and growth, then build and launch new channels from near zero, including Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



This role exists to remove work, decisions, and operational drag from ownership‚Äôs plate.



What You Will Own



Amazon Seller Central is live today and is your first priority. Other channels will be launched under your leadership once foundations are clean and reporting is in place.



You own outcomes across:



Amazon Seller growth, catalog health, pricing, promotions, inventory execution



Paid media performance, Amazon Ads first, then Meta when appropriate



Creative output quality and speed, images, A+ content, storefronts, video briefs



New channel builds and launches, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



You will manage an existing Amazon operations resource and rebuild creative production for speed, accuracy, and quality.



Ownership Expectations (Non-Negotiable)



You are expected to:



Think like an owner, not an employee



Make decisions without constant escalation



Prioritize work based on impact, not comfort



Take responsibility for mistakes and fix them quickly



Actively reduce the owner‚Äôs involvement over time



If you are waiting for instructions, this is not the role.



What Success Looks Like



Within 60 to 90 days:



Fewer day to day questions and approvals needed from ownership



Cleaner execution, fewer errors, faster turnaround



Simple, reliable weekly reporting



Clear 
ntum in Amazon performance and a concrete launch pipeline for new channels



If you do not materially reduce ownership‚Äôs workload, you are not succeeding.



Core Responsibilities



Build a 90-day plan and execute it with weekly cadence



Own Amazon Seller performance, SKUs, pricing, promotions, account health, inventory flow



Improve listing quality, conversion fundamentals, and creative consistency



Own Amazon Ads performance and testing discipline



Implement a simple KPI dashboard, revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, inventory health, next actions



Build and launch Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B channels once approved



Create SOPs so performance does not depend on one person



Hire and manage minimal support, typically 1 to 3 people over time



Required Profile



We are not looking for tool collectors or task executors.



You must have:



3+ years hands-on Amazon Seller Central experience



Proof you improved performance, not just maintained listings



Comfort with inventory, catalog, compliance, and operations



Ownership mindset and long-term thinking



Strong English and 2 to 3 hours daily overlap with Eastern Time



Preference for longer tenures over short contracts



Nice to have, not required:



Experience launching Shopify, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, or Grainger



Experience managing creatives or contractors



Compensation



Base: USD 1,200 to 1,500 per month



Performance upside tied to measurable revenue and margin improvement



Clear path to higher compensation as scope and ownership increase



How to Apply (Required)



Applications missing any item will be rejected.



Resume



A 200-word plan for your first 90 days, specific to our brands



Links to stores or brands you directly worked on, include outcomes where possible



Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video explaining one win and one mistake



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who act like owners, make decisions, and remove work from founders.

If you are looking for instructions, stability without accountability, or task-based work, do not apply.

title: Short-Form Video Editor ‚Äî Golf Interview Clips & Product Ads
description:
We are 
 on all social media platforms (you can look at our account to better understand how we have been editing our clips), a growing golf media brand based in the US. We interview everyday golfers on the course and at driving ranges, and we need a dedicated video editor to turn our raw interview footage into short-form clips for Instagram Reels, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts.

This is a long-term, ongoing position ‚Äî not a one-time project. You will be our full-time editor.



WHAT YOU WILL BE EDITING:

Interview Clips (Primary ‚Äî 80% of the work)

We film 3-10 minute on-course interviews with real golfers. You will watch the raw footage, take each of my questions and their answers and turn them into a video clip. Of course edit them into polished short-form clips, with proper on screen hooks, sound, and cuts in and out to keep the viewer engaged. Each full clip interview typically produces 2-6 clips. We film weekly and have a large backlog, so there is no shortage of footage. We also want to start posting long form YouTube videos of our days at the golf course interviewing golfers.... 



Examples of creator videos on TikTok we like is Caleb 
 
 Product Ads (20% of the work)

We also film product reaction videos where we hand golfers a product (gloves, drinks, gear) and capture their honest reactions. These need to be edited in the style of StreetTalk 
 on Instagram) ‚Äî fast-paced, authentic, with strong hooks.



WHAT EACH CLIP NEEDS:

Bold animated captions throughout (CapCut-style, white text with dark outline, key words highlighted in a brand color)

A text hook in the first 2-3 seconds that creates curiosity and stops the scroll

Jump cuts to remove dead air, filler words, and pauses

Clean audio (reduce wind and background noise when needed)

Brand watermark in bottom right corner with our logo and handle (we will provide)

Vertical 9:16 format, optimized for mobile

Light background music for street interview product ads that does not overpower the conversation and likely no background on our typical interview videos of golfers. 



Occasional B-roll inserts when necessary or makes sense. minimal use of AI B-roll please. 



WHAT WE DO NOT WANT:

Cheesy transitions, flashy effects, or over-editing

Content that feels like a commercial ‚Äî it should feel real and authentic

Inaccurate captions or missing words



VOLUME:

We need approximately 3 finished clips per day (roughly 15-20 per week, 60-90 per month). You will receive raw footage in batches and manage your own schedule to hit daily output.



TOOLS:

CapCut, Premiere Pro, DaVinci Resolve, or Final Cut ‚Äî we do not have a preference as long as the output quality is consistent. You must be able to add animated/dynamic captions natively (not just static subtitles).



WHAT MAKES A GREAT FIT:

You have edited interview-style or podcast-style short-form content before

You understand pacing ‚Äî you know which 
nts to keep and which to cut

You can write short, punchy text hooks that make people stop scrolling

You are reliable and communicative ‚Äî if something comes up, you tell us before a deadline is missed

You watch short-form content yourself and understand what performs on Reels/TikTok



TO APPLY:

Please include a link to 2-3 examples of short-form clips you have edited (interview or conversation style preferred). Again you can reference our socials 
 to better understand what we do so you can send clips that are close to that.



If you do not have interview-style samples, send your best short-form work and we will provide a paid test clip ($10) before making a decision.

title: Tech Stack Implementation Lead (CRM, Outreach Ops and Automation)
description:
# Tech Stack Implementation Lead 

We're standing up our entire operational tech stack from scratch ‚Äî CRM,
 outreach infrastructure, enrichment pipelines, automation workflows, and website ‚Äî and need someone to drive implementation across a distributed technical team.



## The Situation



We have the people and the plan. There's a defined project spanning 8 workstreams with clear ownership assignments across multiple technical tea
mbers. You would be "the someone" making sure it all comes together on time, in the right order, without things breaking each other. 



## What You'll Own



Driving the tech stack buildout from current state to fully operational. That means running the Asana board daily ‚Äî are tasks moving, are blockers surfaced, are dependencies respected (you can't start
 sequences before warm-up completes, DNS changes can't break
 while the website migrates). You'll coordinate across tea
mbers who don't overlap in hours, run lightweight async standups, and be the person who catches integration issues early ‚Äî like Clay outputs not mapping correctly to CRM fields, or outreach domains missing DKIM records.



## The Workstreams You'd Coordinate



- CRM evaluation and setup (HubSpot or alternative)

- LinkedIn Sales Navigator and Apollo configuration

- Clay enrichment waterfall and
 verification pipeline

- Instantly cold
 setup and domain warm-up

- n8n automation deployment and workflow building

- WordPress website migration and hardening

- Slack/M365/Loom workspace configuration



You don't need to do the hands-on technical work, but you need to understand it well enough to know whether it's done right.



## What We're Looking For



Someone who's coordinated technical implementations before ‚Äî SaaS rollouts, CRM migrations, marketing automation builds, or similar. You understand what SPF/DKIM records are, why
 warm-up takes 2-3 weeks, what an API integration means in practice, and how to tell if a WordPress site is properly secured. You live in project management tools (Asana preferred) and communicate clearly in writing. You're comfortable pushing back when timelines slip and escalating when something needs a decision.



## Nice to Have



- Direct experience with any of our stack: HubSpot, Clay, Instantly, n8n, Apollo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator

- Background in B2B lead generation or outreach operations

- Experience managing remote teams across time zones



##What We Offer



Remote, 20 hours/week with flexibility to scale up during peak implementation phases. You'd report directly to the founder and have full visibility into every technical workstream. This is a high-leverage role.



Growth path: This isn't a static role. We're a growing company and we invest in people who invest in us. As the tech stack matures, this role evolves ‚Äî from implementation coordination into ongoing technical operations management, systems optimization, and potentially leading a larger technical team. We support upskilling (tool certifications, new platforms, expanded scope) and adjust compensation as your responsibilities grow. If you're someone who wants to learn, take ownership, and grow with a company rather than just fill a seat, we want to talk to you.



To Apply

Please include the following in your application. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.

1. Subject line: "TSIL - [Your Name]"

2. Brief intro (3-5 sentences max): What's the most complex technical implementation you've coordinated? What tools were involved, how many people, and what was the outcome?

3. Answer these three questions:



You notice that a tea
mber configured DKIM records for the outreach domains but skipped DMARC. The
 warm-up is scheduled to start tomorrow. What do you do and why does it matter?

Two workstreams are about to collide: the WordPress developer is migrating the site to a new server on Monday, and the ops coordinator is switching MX records for Microsoft 365
 the same day. How do you handle this?

A tea
mber marks a task "complete" in Asana but you suspect it wasn't fully done (e.g., "Set up Clay enrichment tables" is marked done but no QA was performed). What's your process?



4. Availability & rate:



Confirm you can commit to 20 hrs/week with the ability to scale up as needed

Your expected hourly rate in USD

Your typical working hours and timezone



5. Loom or short video (optional but strongly preferred): Record a 2-3 minute walkthrough of a project you managed in Asana, Trello, Monday, or any PM tool. Show us how you organized it and tracked progress. This doesn't need to be polished ‚Äî we want to see how you think.

title: Remote Neuropathy Lead Follow-Up & Patient Coordinator
description:
Title: Remote Neuropathy Lead Follow-Up & Patient Coordinator (Evenings/Weekends, US Hours)



About the Role

Nexus Chiropractic (Cary, NC) is looking for a detail-oriented, people-focused Virtual Assistant to own our neuropathy lead follow-up outside office hours. You‚Äôll be the first human contact for people responding to our Meta ads, turning cold form fills into scheduled evaluations, and reactivating old leads. When lead flow is light, you‚Äôll help clean up our CRM and support simple content tasks.

This is NOT a spammy cold-calling role. All leads have requested information and are expecting a response.



Schedule (US Eastern time)

Monday‚ÄìThursday: 6:00 pm ‚Äì 6:00 am (overnight coverage) 

Thursday 6:00 pm ‚Äì Monday 6:00 am (weekend coverage)

***THIS IS  132 hours total per week, so we are looking for 4 VAs to complete coverage for the week***



You don‚Äôt need to be glued to the screen the entire time, but you must be able to respond quickly when new leads come in during these windows.

Core Responsibilities

Speed-to-lead follow-up on all new Meta ad neuropathy leads via text, phone, and
 using our GoHighLevel (GHL) system.

Call/text new leads within minutes, confirm basic info, answer non-clinical questions, and book them into our neuropathy consult slots.

Manage two-way texting inside GHL: reply to questions, send reminders, and keep conversations moving toward a booked appointment.

Re-activate older leads: call/text people who inquired in the past but never scheduled or didn‚Äôt show and offer them new appointment options.

Track every touchpoint: log outcomes, next steps, and notes in GHL so the in-office team has full context. 



During slower periods:

Organize and tag lead lists inside GHL

Help with basic content tasks (e.g., light editing of neuropathy-related posts, formatting, uploading into GHL or social schedulers).

Escalate clinical or complex questions to the clinic team using our protocols.



Success Looks Like

Fast first contact on new leads (goal: under 3 minutes while you‚Äôre on shift). 

High contact rate on new leads (you actually reach and speak/text with them, not just ‚Äúattempted‚Äù).

Strong booking rate from contacted leads into neuropathy evaluations.

Growing show rate for appointments due to consistent reminders and confirmation texts. 

Consistent reactivation of older leads into fresh appointments.



Requirements

Proven experience in:

Appointment setting, patient coordination, or sales/CS roles with outbound calls

Working US hours, ideally evenings/weekends

Excellent spoken and written English; clear, warm, professional communication style.

Comfortable using CRMs (GoHighLevel experience is a plus) and handling multi-channel communication (SMS, phone,
).

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet environment, and your own computer/headset.

Comfortable following scripts and checklists, tracking metrics, and improving based on feedback.



Nice to Have

Experience with healthcare, chiropractic, or wellness clinics.

Familiarity with Meta ads leads and basic content creation/editing.



Compensation

Remote contractor role

Competitive hourly rate, based on experience and skills

Long-term, stable work if performance is strong (we‚Äôd rather grow with one A-player than keep rehiring).



How to Apply

 
 with:

Subject: ‚ÄúVA ‚Äì Neuropathy Lead Follow-Up‚Äù

Your resume or LinkedIn profile

A link to a short video  (2‚Äì3 minutes) explaining:

title: Short Video Editor for TV Show Content
description:
I‚Äôm looking for editors who genuinely love TV and know how to turn scenes into a tight, engaging story.



The style is similar to this:





The goal is to take scenes from a show (sometimes across multiple episodes) and cut them into one clean, streamlined 1‚Äì2 minute storyline that feels cohesive and intentional.



No on-screen text/graphics needed, just simple editing.

Just sharp pacing, smart dialogue trims, and subtle head tracking to keep the frame dynamic.



Requirements:

Adobe Premiere Pro and/or After Effects is required

Strong instinct for which lines to keep and which to cut

Ability to remove silences, filler shots, and anything that drags

Clean, subtle head tracking (plugins like Mocha Pro preferred)

Edits that feel immersive, not flashy

The show

The direction/theme

Clear notes on the style



This is ongoing work for the right editor. I‚Äôm looking for people who naturally watch a scene and think, ‚Äúthis could be way tighter.‚Äù



Because there will likely be a high number of applicants, the best way to guarantee your application is properly reviewed and considered is to create a 100% relevant sample in this exact style and submit it through this form:





Any editor I choose from this application process will be paid for their sample and all subsequent work.



I‚Äôm looking to build long-term relationships and can provide as much ongoing work as you want if it‚Äôs a good fit.

title: Video Editor for High-Volume Performance Ad Creatives (CapCut)
description:
We're a software holding company in the education and software space. We produce a high volume of video ad creatives every week and are looking for a reliable, fast, and organized video editor to join our production team full-time.



The Role

You will be the execution arm of our creative production pipeline. You won't need to come up with ideas or strategies; we have a Creative Strategist and Content Creators who handle that. Your job is to take what they give you and turn it into polished video creatives, fast and consistently.



How the workflow works:

1. Our Content Creator films the raw video footage.

2. Our Creative Strategist writes the scripts and briefs with detailed instructions.

3. Everything is organized in ClickUp  scripts, raw footage, references, and deadlines.

4. You pick up the task, edit the video in CapCut following the brief, and deliver.



That's it. Clear instructions, clear assets, clear deadlines. You edit.



What we provide:

- CapCut Premium account with our brand templates preloaded

- All raw footage, scripts, and creative direction ready for you in ClickUp

- A structured workflow so you always know exactly what to do next

- A supportive team ‚Äî Creative Strategist available for questions and feedback



What we expect:

- Edit 140+ video creatives per week across multiple brands ‚Äî this volume will grow over time as we release new products and scale campaigns

- Follow creative briefs precisely; no guessing, no freelancing the direction

- Deliver on time, every time; deadlines are non-negotiable in paid media

- Stay organized in ClickUp:  update task statuses, communicate progress

- Maintain consistent quality even at high speed

- Be available during working hours and responsive on communication



You're a great fit if:

- You have experience editing short-form video ads (UGC-style, direct response, performance creatives)

- You're fast and comfortable in CapCut (this is our primary editing tool)

- You've worked in a high-volume creative production environment before ‚Äî ideally for DTC or e-commerce brands running paid social

- You're the type of person who thrives with clear instructions and structured workflows

- You're organized, dependable, and take ownership of your output

- You understand that in performance marketing, speed and volume matter just as much as polish



Nice to have (not required):

- Familiarity with Meta Ads creative formats and best practices

- Experience working with a Creative Strategist or in an agency/media buying team

- Basic motion graphics or text animation skills in CapCut



Job Details:

- Type: Full-time (40 hours/week)

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible hours with overlap availability for team communication

- Tools: CapCut Premium (provided), ClickUp (provided)



How to Apply  (Read Carefully)

- We have a fast and clear hiring process. If you don't follow these steps, your application will not be considered.



Step 1: Record a Loom Video (5-10 minutes)

Record a short Loom video where you walk us through the following. 

- Your background: who you are and your experience as a video editor

- Companies you've worked with specifically, have you worked with DTC brands, e-commerce companies, or teams running paid social ads? Which ones? What kind of creatives did you produce?

- Volume: what's the highest volume of creatives you've managed in a week? How did you handle it? What systems or habits allowed you to keep up?

- Your previous workflow: what was the production pipeline? Who gave you instructions: a creative strategist, a media buyer, a brand manager? How did you receive briefs and assets?

- How you edited: walk us through your process, your tools, and how you approach a batch of edits

- Deadlines: how do you ensure you hit every deadline when the workload is heavy? Give us a real example

- Show examples: screen-share and show us previous ad creatives or short-form videos you've edited



Step 2: Send Us an

Send an
 to 
 with the subject line "Video Editor Application ‚Äî [Your Name]" including:

- Your Loom video link

- Your CV / resume

- Your availability to start



What happens next:

- We'll review all applications within 2 days

- Top candidates will be invited to a short final video call with the founder

- If it's a fit, you'll be hired immediately after the call no long waiting periods



We move fast and we're looking for someone who does too. Looking forward to hearing from you.

title: Jewelry CAD Modeler ‚Äì Full-Time Long-Term Position
description:
We are a growing jewelry company building a large wholesale collection and we are looking for a reliable, full-time Jewelry CAD Modeler to join us long-term.



This is production-focused work across rings, pendants, earrings, and bracelets. The focus is clean, manufacturable, casting-ready designs suitable for wholesale production.



Your role will be to create ORIGINAL, production-ready 3D jewelry CAD models based on style direction and reference images. Reference images are provided to communicate the desired aesthetic. The final designs must be original (not direct replicas) and suitable for manufacturing and resale.



Responsibilities include creating 3D jewelry models using Rhino (preferred), delivering STL files plus editable source files, maintaining proper wall thickness for casting, preparing clean and manufacturable geometry, providing metal weight estimates, and making revisions when required.



This is a full-time remote position with a stable monthly salary. We plan to develop approximately 80‚Äì100 models per month, so efficiency and consistency are very important.



Requirements: experience in jewelry CAD modeling, understanding of casting process, knowledge of shrinkage and tolerances, fast modeling speed, organized and responsive communication, and good English skills.



Salary is a competitive fixed monthly rate based on experience and expected output.



When applying, please include:

‚Ä¢ The software you use

‚Ä¢ 2‚Äì3 examples of production-ready jewelry models

‚Ä¢ Your expected monthly salary

‚Ä¢ How many models you can complete per week



We are looking for someone reliable, production-oriented, and interested in long-term collaboration.
