We are hiring a Remote Spa Receptionist to handle inbound calls and book spa appointments. This is a long-term, performance-based role. Calls are recorded and reviewed regularly. Retention depends on accuracy, professionalism, booking success, consistent attendance, no missed calls during scheduled shifts, fast response time, and the ability to professionally handle complaints and de-escalate upset clients.



To apply: Please copy the questions below, paste them in your reply, and answer each one thoroughly.



(1) Location & Utilities: Where in the Philippines are you currently located? How often have you experienced power or internet outages in the past year? Do you have backup solutions (e.g., generator, mobile hotspot) to ensure your work is not affected?



(2) Home Setup: Will you be working from home? Is your workspace quiet and suitable for handling calls? Do you have your own computer or laptop? Please attach a screenshot of your current internet speed.



(3) Availability & Speed: Can you consistently work seven days a week, six hours per day, and remain available for the full shift without missed calls? How quickly do you typically answer inbound calls? What is your current typing speed in words per minute?



(4) Call & Complaint Experience: Describe your experience with answering inbound calls, booking or scheduling appointments, customer service, following scripts, and handling complaints. Provide one real example of how you de-escalated an upset client and the outcome.



(5) Tools & Systems: What programs, tools, phone systems, or VoIP platforms have you used for handling calls? Do you have any issues with background noise, power outages, or internet interruptions? How do you take notes and log client interactions during calls?



(6) Voice Recordings: Please submit two short voice recordings. Recording one should demonstrate booking an appointment from 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM with a total amount of $60. Recording two should demonstrate handling a double charge for a 90-minute massage where the client sees two $90 charges and is requesting a refund. Your tone should be calm, polite, and professional.



(7) Current Job: Do you currently have another job? If yes, where, how many hours per week, and what are your roles and tasks in that job?



(8) Schedule, Pay & Start Date: Are you able to work seven days a week, six hours per day, during Central Standard Time (CST) hours without conflicts? What is your expected hourly or monthly rate? What is your earliest physical start date if hired?



(9) Marketing, Design & Video: Do you have experience with online marketing, creating content using Canva, or producing short video clips such as
 Reels or similar platforms? Please describe your skills and provide samples of your previous work if available.



(10) Fit, Skills & Experience: Briefly introduce yourself and explain why you would be a good fit for this role. Include what you believe is most important when handling spa clients over the phone, especially during complaints, and what other skills or areas you have a lot of experience in.

title: Retail & Distributor Outreach Assistant (Part-Time, Contractor) plus commissions & bonuses
description:
About the Role



I‚Äôm the founder of a growing natural, vegan skincare and sunscreen brand based in the UK. I‚Äôm looking for a reliable, detail-oriented assistant to help manage outreach to retail stockists and distributors.



This role is suited to someone with sales or lead-generation experience who understands wholesale ecosystems and can confidently distinguish between brands, retailers/stockists, distributors, and competitors.



You‚Äôll be responsible for keeping a high-quality outreach pipeline active and organised. I will handle closing and final negotiations.



Hours & Schedule



- Independent contractor role (hourly)



- Part-time: 12 hours per week



- Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday



- 4 hours per day



- Some overlap with UK business hours required



- Start date: ASAP



- Long-term role for the right person





Key Responsibilities



Outreach & Follow-Ups



- Send outreach
s to appropriate retail stockists and distributors



- Personalise
s thoughtfully (not mass outreach)



- Adapt and improve outreach templates over time



- Manage follow-ups and track responses clearly





Lead sourcing & tracking



- Track every account in a simple pipeline tracker or spreadsheet



- Correctly classify leads as:



- Company-Sourced (we provide the target company; you find contacts and manage follow-up)

- Assistant-Sourced (you independently identify a suitable retail stockist or distributor)



- Use judgement to flag borderline, strategic, or unsuitable accounts before outreach



- Confirm sourcing status in the tracker if unclear before spending time on it





Sales Cycle & Pipeline Support



- Support the sales process from prospecting to warm lead handover



- Qualify retailers and distributors based on brand fit



- Maintain clear notes on outreach status and next steps





Research & Prospecting



- Research and identify genuine multi-brand retail stockists and aligned distributors



- Identify correct buyers, founders, or category contacts



- Build and maintain a curated outreach list (quality over volume)





Communication & Reporting



- Clearly summarise replies and actions required



- Flag interested or time-sensitive leads promptly



- Maintain an organised spreadsheet or CRM





Requirements



- Experience in wholesale sales, B2B outreach, account management, or lead generation



- Clear understanding of the difference between:



- brands vs retailers/stockists

- competitors vs wholesale accounts

- boutiques vs large chains



- Understanding of the sales cycle and follow-up process



- Strong written English



- Excellent organisation and attention to detail



- Confident researching companies and decision-makers



- Comfortable using Google Sheets and/or CRMs (PipeDrive a plus)



- LinkedIn outreach experience preferred





What This Role Is Not



- No cold calling



- No closing or negotiation



- No aggressive sales tactics





Tools



- Gmail



- Google Sheets or CRM (PipeDrive)



- Templates, training, and brand materials provided



- Hubstaff used for time tracking (not micromanagement)





Pay



- PHP 250/hour, paid monthly



- Commission applies to the first paid order only from Assistant-Sourced accounts



- One-off bonuses apply to Company-Sourced accounts



- Commission/bonuses paid after cleared payment is received



(At 12 hours/week, approx. PHP 12,900/month + bonuses.)



How to Apply



 
 with ref SO26 and include:



- A short summary of your experience with sales, outreach, or wholesale support



- How you track outreach and follow-ups



- A short sample outreach
 introducing a natural skincare brand to a retail stockist



-A 1‚Äì2 minute Loom video explaining why you‚Äôre interested in this specific role and Baie Botanique



NB: Applications without a Loom link will not be reviewed.

This is a high-accountability role for someone who ensures the CEO‚Äôs day-to-day operations run with precision and consistency‚Äîcommunications, scheduling, team coordination, and administration executed seamlessly, without reminders. You will have a passion for efficiency, proactively suggesting AI-based workflows to improve and streamline systems.



Key Responsibilities

Inbox management: Proactively monitor, triage, organise, and draft responses; ensure timely follow-through; maintain a clean, current inbox and clear priorities.



Calendar management: Manage the CEO‚Äôs diary end-to-end, protect focus time, schedule intelligently, and prevent conflicts and last-minute disruption.



Scheduling and coordination: Arrange meetings with internal and external stakeholders, manage reschedules, confirm attendance, distribute logistics, and ensure meetings are set up properly.



Team coordination and delegation: Act as the CEO‚Äôs operational bridge to team leads and individual tea
mbers‚Äîcommunicating priorities, following up on deliverables, ensuring accountability across the team, and escalating blockers before they become problems. You will coordinate cross-functional tasks, ensure alignment on deadlines, and keep projects moving without the CEO needing to chase progress.



Executive-level stakeholder communication: Communicate professionally and confidently with executive clients, partners, stakeholders, and tea
mbers via phone and
, representing the CEO and company appropriately at all times.



ClickUp task, workflow, and project management: Capture actions, create and assign tasks, track progress, maintain visibility, and ensure completion‚Äîwithout the CEO needing to follow up.



AI workflow optimisation: Identify opportunities to streamline repetitive processes using AI tools, recommend and implement efficiency improvements, and stay across emerging productivity tools relevant to executive operations.



General executive administration: Preparation of documents, tracking and coordination of action items, and other administrative tasks required to keep execution moving smoothly.



Required Experience and Capabilities

 ? Minimum 6 years‚Äô experience as an Executive Assistant supporting a CEO (or equivalent senior executive), ideally within a tech, SaaS, or startup environment.

 ? Excellent communication skills (phone and written): clear, concise, professional, and responsive; able to engage confidently with senior stakeholders.

 ? Proven ability to coordinate across teams‚Äîdelegating on behalf of the CEO, managing follow-ups with team leads and individual contributors, and maintaining accountability without direct authority.

 ? High accountability: takes ownership of outcomes, follows through reliably, and ensures tasks are completed without prompting.

 ? Operational excellence: highly organised, detail-focused, and able to manage multiple priorities effectively.

 ? Seamless execution: anticipates needs, stays ahead of schedules and deliverables, and ensures the CEO‚Äôs week runs efficiently and predictably.

 ? Demonstrated interest in or experience with AI productivity tools and a willingness to continuously improve workflows.

 ? Availability aligned to Sydney business hours (AEST/AEDT).



Required Tools Proficiency

 ? Google Workspace and Microsoft 365

 ? Google Meet, Zoom, and Microsoft Teams

 ? ClickUp (CRM, project management, team communication)

 ? Calendar scheduling tools (e.g. Calendly, 
, or similar)

 ? Familiarity with AI productivity tools (e.g. ChatGPT, Claude, Notion AI, or similar) is highly regarded

Desirable (Not Required)

 ? Experience supporting founders or CEOs in legal technology, SaaS, or high-growth startups

 ? Familiarity with investor relations coordination (scheduling, document preparation, follow-ups)

 ? Experience working with distributed or remote teams across multiple time zones

To apply for this role:



HOW TO APPLY:



To apply for the position, please send: 

a freshly recorded face-to-camera video explaining why you want the role and why you are the ideal candidate - Not AI Generated.

Your resume

title: Client Fulfillment Specialist (AI-Driven Operations)

Why Gymtopia

title: Company Finance Manager
description:
About Us

We are a growing short-term rental and property management company managing a diverse portfolio across Australia. As our business continues to scale, we are looking for a Company Finance Manager to take ownership of our financial operations and ensure accuracy, compliance, and clarity across multiple accounts.



The Role

This role is ideal for someone with a strong accounting foundation who is confident working in Xero, experienced in bank and trust account reconciliations, and willing to learn industry-specific systems such as short term rental trust accounting.



You will play a key role in keeping our financials organised, compliant, and ready for growth.



Key Responsibilities

-Manage company financial accounts and daily financial operations

-Perform bank reconciliations across multiple accounts

-Handle STR trust account reconciliations accurately and in compliance

-Maintain and manage financial records using Xero

-Prepare reports and support month-end processes

-Work closely with management to ensure financial clarity and accountability

-Learn and assist with Property Tree trust accounting and reporting (training provided)



About You

-Background in Accounting, Finance, or Bookkeeping

-Proven experience using Xero

-Strong understanding of bank reconciliations

-Experience with trust accounts (property or STR experience highly regarded)

-Detail-oriented, organised, and highly reliable

-Willing to learn STR-specific trust accounting 

-Comfortable working independently and remotely



Why Join Us

-Be part of a growing property and short-term rental business

-Long-term role with opportunities to expand responsibilities

-Supportive team and hands-on exposure to property trust accounting

-Flexible working environment



???? How to Apply:

Please send your CV and a brief introduction outlining your accounting experience and familiarity with Xero and trust accounts.

title: Project manager
description:
Job Title

Project Manager ‚Äì AI Operations & Delivery

About the Company

We‚Äôre building a managed AI agent service that helps businesses reduce repetitive admin and run more smoothly.

We design, deploy, and maintain AI agents that handle operational and outreach tasks (enquiries, routing, follow-ups, summaries), allowing teams to focus on higher-value work. This is a service-led business, not a software platform or chatbot company.

Our focus is reliability, clarity, and calm execution.

The Role

We‚Äôre looking for a Project Manager to own client delivery from onboarding through go-live and ongoing optimisation.

This role is about coordination, structure, and follow-through. You‚Äôll sit between sales, prompt/agent engineering, and the client, making sure projects move smoothly, on scope, and without chaos.

This is not a technical PM role, but you must be comfortable working with automation, workflows, and AI-based systems.

What You‚Äôll Be Responsible For

Managing client onboarding and delivery timelines

Translating client requirements into clear delivery tasks

Coordinating work between prompt engineers, automation builders, and stakeholders

Keeping projects on scope, on time, and well-documented

Managing change requests and expectations calmly

Ensuring clients feel informed and confident throughout delivery

Overseeing handover into managed, ongoing service

You‚Äôll be the person who makes sure nothing slips, even as multiple projects run in parallel.

Who We‚Äôre Looking For

You‚Äôre likely a good fit if you:

Are highly organised and methodical

Communicate clearly and calmly with clients

Enjoy bringing order to messy processes

Are comfortable managing technical-adjacent projects without being hands-on technical

Prefer structured delivery over constant firefighting

Experience

Proven experience as a Project Manager (agency, SaaS, IT services, or operations preferred)

Comfortable managing multiple stakeholders

Experience with automation, digital tools, or systems projects is a strong plus

Familiarity with tools like Notion, Google Workspace, Slack, ClickUp, Asana, etc.

What This Role Is Not

Not software engineering

Not product management

Not marketing project management

Not startup chaos

This is about predictable, repeatable delivery.

Working Style

Calm, professional, and structured

Clear documentation and communication

No unnecessary meetings

Focus on outcomes, not activity

Contract / Location

Remote-friendly

Contract or permanent (open to discussion)

Part-time initially, with potential to grow

How to Apply

Send:

A short introduction

A brief summary of relevant project experience

One-Line Summary (For Job Boards)

Own the delivery of reliable AI systems that quietly run the repetitive parts of real businesses.

title: Claims Officer (Work-from-Home)
description:
ABOUT US



We are a purpose-driven service company committed to assisting individuals through one of life‚Äôs most challenging times. At SuperCare, we believe that health and well-being should always come first. As a pioneering Australian company, we empower eligible individuals to access essential medical treatments by facilitating the early release of their Superannuation on compassionate grounds. For over a decade, we have been making a meaningful impact, helping thousands ease their financial burdens while prioritising their health.



With offices strategically located in Sydney and Canberra, we provide nationwide support to ensure our clients receive the care they need, wherever they are. As industry leader, we are committed to continuous innovation, delivering exceptional client experiences, and fostering a workplace culture that promotes professional growth and collaboration.



As we continue to grow, we are excited to invite an experienced and highly competent Claims Officer to help with our mission of transforming lives.







THE ROLE



The Claims Officer plays a pivotal role in ensuring client satisfaction and engagement. Responsible for managing a portfolio of assigned clients though each stage of the application process for the early release of Superannuation due to compassionate grounds. Ensure a seamless client experience through every touch point. Provide expert-level support to our clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and going above and beyond to exceed expectations.



As a dedicated consultant, serve as the primary contact in addressing all client inquiries and concerns. Take ownership and accountable for a sustainable high level of performance in critical areas of (1) Client Engagement and (2) Service Delivery.



Ensure that clients are achieving their desired outcome as well as maximum value from SuperCare services. Nurture a Culture of Trust & Accountability by serving as a role model in reinforcing SuperCare Core Values and ethical behavior.



Provide valuable insights into continuous improvement of the service offerings as well as the Client Experience.







Responsibilities:



Review support documents to ensure compliance with ATO guidelines



Schedule the lodgment



Lodge the application to the Australian Taxation Office (ATO)



Maintain regular updates with clients in each stage of the application process, including ATO approval, through various channels, including phone calls,
s, and SMS



Resolve all client inquiries and concerns with empathy, urgency, and professionalism



Uphold SuperCare policies and procedures while adhering to service level agreements (SLAs) with clients







THE PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



At least 1 year of experience in a customer service role, preferably in a corporate setting within a service industry such as insurance and banking industries



Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build rapport with clients and colleagues



Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to detail



Proficiency in using CRM and other relevant tools



Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities



A proactive approach to problem-solving and a strong commitment to delivering exceptional service while consistently ensuring compliance with all internal and external regulations



A client-first mindset with a strong sense of empathy and accountability







THE OFFER



Competitive compensation commensurate with experience



Opportunity for professional development and advancement within SuperCare



A dynamic and supportive work environment committed to an engaging Workforce Experience



Comprehensive training program





REQUIREMENTS:



Fast and reliable internet connection

Stable power supply with a backup power source, including UPS





HOW TO APPLY





If you are passionate about making a meaningful impact and thrive in a collaborative, innovative setting, we‚Äôd love to hear from you! Join us at SuperCare and be part of a team that is changing lives every single day. Apply now and take the next step in your career! Please send us your comprehensive resume.

???? Who Typically Succeeds Here



Designers who:

+ Want long-term collaboration rather than one-off gigs

Phong (Peter) Nguyen

title: Part-Time Virtual Assistant + Project Manager (Digital Agency)
description:
I run a small digital consultancy based in New Zealand, working with clients around the world on website development, ecommerce, SEO, and digital strategy. We‚Äôre a small, capable 3-person team, and I‚Äôm looking for a Virtual Assistant + Project Manager to become the operational backbone of the business; someone who will help keep projects organised, make sure tasks don‚Äôt get dropped, and help us run in a more proactive and structured way.



This is not just a basic admin role. This is a high-trust, long-term operations role where you will help keep the business running smoothly and ensure nothing falls through the cracks.



Your core job will be keeping our project management system up to date, keeping projects and tasks accurate, current, and useful so the team always knows what to work on next. If you enjoy bringing order to busy teams and making things run smoothly, this could be a great fit.



Core responsibilities:



Project management & coordination (this is the most important part of the role). You will effectively become the single source of truth for what the team is working on. 

- Create and update tasks, timelines, and priorities

- Ensure no tasks get dropped or forgotten

- Convert
s/messages into structured tasks

- Follow up with tea
mbers on deadlines and next steps

- Prepare weekly task plans and capacity overviews

- Help plan upcoming work and resource allocation

- Flag risks, delays, or overload early

- Help keep projects moving forward





Client & admin support

- Inbox checking and drafting replies

- Converting
s into tasks/projects

- Scheduling meetings and managing calendars

- Preparing agendas and meeting notes

- Light client communication and follow-ups

- Formatting proposals and documents

- Keeping Google Drive organised

- Maintaining SOPs and documentation

- Basic admin and bookkeeping support (Invoice prep, timesheet checks, reporting)



Operations & process improvement (We want someone who can help us improve systems over time).

- Improve workflows and organisation

- Keep documentation tidy and useful

- Help move the business from reactive ? proactive

- Prepare weekly reports

- Help with planning and forecasting

- General ‚Äúmake things run smoothly‚Äù support



Optional/secondary tasks (only if you‚Äôre interested) - if you have skills in these areas, you may be able to assist:

- SEO support

- Website content updates

- Basic Shopify or website maintenance

- Data reporting

- CRO/testing coordination

- Content formatting

- Light digital marketing tasks

Note: These are not required. The main role is PM + VA.



Tools we use

- Productive (PM + resource planning)

- Google Workspace

- Slack

- Shopify

- SEO tools (SEMRush, GSC, SEO Powersuite)

- AirTable

You don‚Äôt need experience with all of these, but you must be comfortable learning new systems quickly.



Ideal candidate

You‚Äôll be a great fit if you:

- Have experience as a VA, project manager, or operations coordinator

- Have worked with digital agencies, developers, or marketing teams

- Are highly organised and detail-oriented

- Are confident using PM tools

- Communicate clearly and reliably

- Take initiative and follow through

- Can work independently

- Are proactive and not afraid to ask questions

- Are comfortable managing tasks for a small team



Strong candidates

You are likely a strong fit if you have worked as:

- Agency project manager

- Operations manager

- Technical VA for developers

- SEO project manager

- Digital marketing coordinator

- Web project coordinator



You are probably not a fit if:

- You only have basic admin experience

- You haven‚Äôt worked with digital/tech teams

- You prefer being told exactly what to do

- You are uncomfortable following up with people

- You don‚Äôt like managing tasks and deadlines

- This role requires someone who can take ownership and keep things moving.



What success looks like

- After 1‚Äì2 months:

- Our PM system is always up to date

- No tasks get dropped

- Weekly planning runs smoothly

- The team knows what to work on

- I feel less mental load

- Projects move faster



Working style

We‚Äôre a friendly, professional team that values:

- Clear communication

- Reliability

- Initiative

- Long-term working relationships

- Calm, organised workflows



This is a long-term role for the right person.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who can grow with the business.



Hours & pay

-  ~20 hours/week to start

- Flexible scheduling

- Potential to grow over time

- Please include your hourly rate in your application



We will likely start with a paid trial period to ensure it‚Äôs a good fit for both sides.



How to apply

Please include:

- A short intro about yourself

- Your experience in similar roles

- Tools you‚Äôve used (especially PM tools)

- Your availability

- Your hourly rate

- Examples of teams you‚Äôve supported

- Any SEO or digital skills you have



If it sounds like a good fit, we‚Äôll organise a short call :)



We‚Äôre looking for someone reliable, proactive, and long-term.

If you enjoy keeping projects organised and helping teams run smoothly, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Cold Email/Clay GTM Expert Needed for Client Account Management
description:
We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced Cold
/Clay GTM Expert to manage and optimize cold
 outreach campaigns for our client accounts. This role requires a deep understanding of cold
 best practices, a proven track record of success using Clay for lead generation and list building, and strong analytical skills to track and improve campaign performance.



The ideal candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end management of cold
 initiatives using Instantly.ai, from strategy development and list building to
 copywriting and performance reporting, ultimately driving qualified leads and revenue for our clients.

Responsibilities:



APPLY HERE: 



Develop and execute cold
 strategies aligned with client objectives and target audiences.

- Craft compelling and personalized
 copy that resonates with recipients and encourages engagement.

- Manage
 deliverability and optimize sender reputation to minimize spam complaints and maximize inbox placement.

- Implement A/B testing strategies to optimize

- Monitor and analyze campaign performance using key metrics (open rates, click-through rates, response rates, conversion rates).

- Stay up-to-date on the latest cold

- Collaborate with internal teams (sales, marketing) to ensure alignment and maximize campaign effectiveness.

- Troubleshoot technical issues related to
 delivery and Clay platform.

- Manage client communication and provide exceptional customer service.     



Requirements:

- 1+ years of experience in cold
 marketing and lead generation.

- Proficiency with Clay for lead generation, data enrichment, and list building.

- Proven track record of developing and executing successful cold
 campaigns that drive measurable results.

- Deep understanding of
 deliverability best practices and sender reputation management.

- Strong copywriting skills with the ability to craft compelling and personalized
 copy.

- Excellent analytical skills and the ability to interpret data to identify trends and optimize campaign performance.

- Proficiency with Instantly.ai

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

- Familiarity with data privacy regulations (e.g., CAN-SPAM, GDPR, CCPA).

title: Executive Virtual Assistant ‚Äì Real Estate Operations & Onboarding
description:
???? ROLE: Executive Assistant / Operations & Onboarding Director



Position Title: Executive Virtual Assistant ‚Äì Real Estate Operations & Onboarding

Company: We Partners Network | eXp Realty

Location: Remote (Philippines preferred)

Hours: Full-Time

Compensation: Based on experience



???? Who We Are



We Partners Network is a fast-growing global real estate organization powered by eXp Realty. We are building a culture-driven, high-performance community of real estate entrepreneurs with a mission to create generational wealth and impact.



We are led by Daniel Eng, commercial real estate investor and team leader, currently building a 300+ agent organization scaling toward 1,000+ partners.



We are looking for a high-level Executive Assistant who thrives in structured environments, loves people, and can lead systems, onboarding, CRM, and operations.



???? This Is NOT a Basic VA Role



This role will:



‚Ä¢ Manage and oversee two existing VAs

‚Ä¢ Own onboarding systems for new agents

‚Ä¢ Oversee CRM and database integrity

‚Ä¢ Help build and implement SOPs

‚Ä¢ Coordinate events and agent follow-ups

‚Ä¢ Support recruiting and retention campaigns

‚Ä¢ Manage executive calendar + meeting flow

‚Ä¢ Execute newsletters and 33 Touch campaigns

‚Ä¢ Track weekly P&L reporting

‚Ä¢ Oversee contracts + onboarding documents

‚Ä¢ Act as liaison between vendors + leadership



You will become the operational backbone of a rapidly scaling organization.



???? Ideal Candidate Profile



‚Ä¢ Detail-oriented (nothing slips through the cracks)

‚Ä¢ High S / C personality (DISC profile preferred)

‚Ä¢ Organized and structured thinker

‚Ä¢ Friendly and relationship-driven

‚Ä¢ Comfortable leading and managing others

‚Ä¢ Strong written English

‚Ä¢ Experience with CRM systems (Follow Up Boss, GoHighLevel, or similar)

‚Ä¢ Experience with onboarding systems and SOP development

‚Ä¢ Comfortable tracking metrics and reporting





???? Core Responsibilities



Onboarding & Agent Experience

 ‚Ä¢ Oversee new agent onboarding process

 ‚Ä¢ Schedule first 100-day training calendar

 ‚Ä¢ Manage onboarding documents + contracts

 ‚Ä¢ Follow up with all event attendees

 ‚Ä¢ Recruiting follow-ups

 ‚Ä¢ Retention follow-ups

 ‚Ä¢ Send cards, gifts, and newsletters



CRM & Systems

 ‚Ä¢ Manage CRM database accuracy

 ‚Ä¢ Implement 33 Touch system

 ‚Ä¢ Oversee lead tracking

 ‚Ä¢ Create follow-up campaigns

 ‚Ä¢ Develop SOPs



Executive Support

 ‚Ä¢ Calendar management

 ‚Ä¢ Meeting scheduling

 ‚Ä¢ Weekly reporting

 ‚Ä¢ Vendor coordination

 ‚Ä¢ Community event coordination

 ‚Ä¢ Website oversight (Ylopo)



Team Oversight

 ‚Ä¢ Manage two VAs

 ‚Ä¢ Assign task workflow

 ‚Ä¢ Ensure deadlines are met



???? What Success Looks Like (First 90 Days)

 ‚Ä¢ All onboarding fully systemized

 ‚Ä¢ CRM fully organized and clean

 ‚Ä¢ Weekly dashboard reports delivered

 ‚Ä¢ Event follow-ups automated

 ‚Ä¢ 33 Touch fully implemented

 ‚Ä¢ SOP library started

 ‚Ä¢ Calendar fully optimized



???? How to Apply

 1. Send your resume.

 2. Send a short video (2‚Äì3 minutes) explaining:

 ‚Ä¢ Why you are a good fit

 ‚Ä¢ Your experience managing teams

 ‚Ä¢ Your experience with CRM systems

 3. In your message include the word ‚ÄúFoundation‚Äù so we know you read this post.



???? SYSTEMS & STRUCTURE

 1. Walk me through how you would onboard a new real estate agent from day 1 to day 30.

 2. How do you ensure nothing falls through the cracks?

 3. What CRM systems have you used? What did you like/dislike?

 4. If our CRM is messy with 1,000+ contacts, what would you do first?

 5. How do you build an SOP from scratch?





???? LEADERSHIP & MANAGEMENT

 6. Have you ever managed other VAs? How did you hold them accountable?

 7. If one VA keeps missing deadlines, how would you handle it?

 8. How do you prioritize tasks when everything feels urgent?





???? ORGANIZATION & REPORTING

 9. Have you created weekly reports before? What metrics did you track?

 10. How would you track recruiting follow-ups and retention?

 11. What tools do you use to stay organized?





???? COMMUNICATION & CULTURE

 12. How would you follow up with a new agent who hasn‚Äôt attended training?

 13. How would you help create a culture remotely?

 14. How do you handle difficult personalities?



???? STRATEGIC THINKING

 15. If we want to grow from 300 agents to 1,000, what systems must be built?

 16. What would you automate first?

 17. What would you delegate?
